page.title: 01Hankelow in Rural Cheshire
page.content: This is a very fertile part of south Cheshire. The river Weaver cuts through the middle, and the Shropshire Union canal, very popular with holiday-makers in the summer, also runs through it. The land is ideal for keeping both dairy and beef cattle. There is one intensive pig farm, with some three hundred pigs, which also has a hen battery-house. One of the farms in Hankelow produces a variety of hard cheeses including Cheshire & Cheddar: it employs six people. There is a small engineering firm making agricultural wires & animal crushes: it employes eleven people. In the event of a nuclear war, the South Cheshire regional seat of Government will be the nuclear bunker sited in the North-West corner of this area.
